DOC.brief_summary: High-risk obstetrical patient Intervention promote Birth Interval Spacing utilize Contraceptive CHOICE project script reduce Unintended Subsequent pregnancy ( HIBISCUS ) collaborative study utilizing qualitative method assess acceptability include family planning specialist 's postpartum contraception counsel prenatal care among Latina obstetric woman pre-gestational diabetes . The investigator compare effectiveness HIBISCUS versus usual contraceptive counsel Long-Acting Reversible Contraception ( LARC ) use 3 month postpartum .
DOC.brief_title: High-risk Obstetrical Patient Intervention Utilizing Contraceptive CHOICE Project Script
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose research address gap long-acting reversible contraception ( LARC ) counseling among Latinas pregnancy complicate pre-gestational diabetes order promote optimal birth-to-pregnancy spacing plan pregnancy optimal glucose control . The investigator utilize Contraceptive CHOICE project LARC focus counsel script remove cost contraception . This study LARC utilization 75 % compare national use LARC 7.2 % The investigator conduct pilot randomize control trial among Latina obstetrics patient pre-gestational diabetes involve prenatal postpartum visit family plan specialist versus usual contraceptive counseling . The family plan specialist counsel utilize Contraceptive CHOICE Project script promote LARC , 18 month birth-to-pregnancy recommendation preconception counseling . The intervention 's name HIBISCUS .
